Sunday, January 6, 2013 – 1-5 pm - FREE
JOINT EXHIBITION OF JAZZ-INSPIRED ARTWORK – ANDRES CHAPARRO & MAURICE ROBERTSON
Opening Reception to kick off the Baby Grand Jazz Series
Hartford Public Library (Atrium) - 500 Main Street – Hartford 860-695-6293
Join painter Andres Chaparro and photographer Maurice D. Robertson for a joint exhibition of their jazz-inspired artwork. The opening reception is free and open to the public. The afternoon will also kick off the Baby Grand Jazz Series, which features from 3-4pm, pianist Warren Byrd and trumpeter, Saskia Laroo.

Baby Grand Jazz will open its 10th season at Hartford Public Library with its first performance on Sunday, January 6, 2013.

 "Hartford Public Library's Baby Grand Jazz series for 2013 promises to be transforming with new musicians and past favorites adding their own unique spin on the art of the improvisers," said Maurice Robertson, host of the University of Hartford’s WWUH 91.3 FM and program committee chair of Hartford Jazz Society.

Concurrently with the start of the 2013 Baby Grand Jazz Series, Hartford Public Library will host two exhibits by

Maurice Robertson

’s photos are expressions of sounds in motion. Through this photo project, he attempts to convey to the viewer both the meditative qualities and the outward flowing dynamism of musicians caught in the act of improvisation. Robertson is a photographer of music, dance and the world of nature. Working with light as an intimate partner in this artistic voyage has increased his sensitivity and awareness of the constant enfoldment of life, and its myriad plots and directions.

Andres Chaparro

’s paintings are directly impacted by what he is listening to at the time. They become a visual representation of the music. "I am not pursuing perfection through my paintings; rather I strive to create art that is honest and true. My work is heavily influenced by jazz music. It inspires me, and like jazz, my art is improvised. I never start out actually knowing where the painting is going and when it will end," said Chaparro.

Andres Chaparro was born in Hartford and is a self-taught artist. Although he studied art history in college, he has never taken an instructional art class.
